quotes.quote: LSD is just a tool to turn us into what we are supposed to be.
quotes.author: Albert Hofmann

quotes.quote: Go to the meadows, go to the garden, go to the woods. Open your eyes!
quotes.author: Albert Hofmann

quotes.quote: It's very, very dangerous to lose contact with living nature.
quotes.author: Albert Hofmann

quotes.quote: I go back to where I came from, to where I was before I was born, that’s all.
quotes.author: Albert Hofmann

quotes.quote: I became very sensitive to what will happen to all this and all of us.
quotes.author: Albert Hofmann

quotes.quote: Evolution of mankind is paralleled by the increase and expansion of consciousness.
quotes.author: Albert Hofmann

quotes.quote: The cost of sanity in this society, is a certain level of alienation.
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: If you don't have a plan, you become part of somebody else's plan.
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: Only psychos and shamans create their own reality.
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: Nature is not our enemy, to be raped and conquered. Nature is ourselves, to be cherished and explored.
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: The problem is not to find the answer, it's to face the answer.
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: Half the time you think your thinking you’re actually listening.
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: Nobody is smarter than you are. And what if they are? What good is their understanding doing you?
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: There is a transcendental dimension beyond language... It's just hard as hell to talk about!
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: The imagination is the goal of history. I see culture as an effort to literally realize our collective dreams.
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: I’ll try to be around and about. But if I’m not, then you know that I’m behind your eyelids, and I’ll meet you there.
quotes.author: Terence Mckenna

quotes.quote: Think for yourself. Question authority.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: You're only as young as the last time you changed your mind.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: Intelligence is the ultimate aphrodisiac.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: The universe is an intelligence test.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: If you listen to neurologists and psychiatrists, you'd never fall in love.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: The PC is the LSD of the '90s.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: The most important thing you do in your life is to die.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: Any reality is an opinion-we make up our own reality.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: If you want to change the way people respond to you, change the way you respond to people.
quotes.author: Timothy Leary

quotes.quote: We're all just walking each other home.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: We're fascinated by the words--but where we meet is in the silence behind them.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: It is important to expect nothing, to take every experience, including the negative ones, as merely steps on the path, and to proceed.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: The heart surrenders everything to the moment. The mind judges and holds back.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: As long as you have certain desires about how it ought to be you can't see how it is.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: Your problem is you are too busy holding on to your unworthiness.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: We're here to awaken from the illusion of separateness.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: Every religion is the product of the conceptual mind attempting to describe the mystery.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: Learn to watch your drama unfold while at the same time knowing you are more than your drama.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: The game is not about becoming somebody, it's about becoming nobody.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: I'm not interested in being a 'lover.' I'm interested in only being love.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: The next message you need is always right where you are.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: A feeling of aversion or attachment toward something is your clue that there's work to be done.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: Everything changes once we identify with being the witness to the story, instead of the actor in it.
quotes.author: Ram Dass

quotes.quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: The more powerful and original a mind, the more it will incline towards the religion of solitude.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: If one's different, one's bound to be lonely.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: I want to know what passion is. I want to feel something strongly.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: An intellectual is a person who has discovered something more interesting than sex.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Happiness is not achieved by the conscious pursuit of happiness; it is generally the by-product of other activities.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: I like being myself. Myself and nasty.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: he secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age, which means never losing your enthusiasm.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: There are things known and there are things unknown, and in between are the doors of perception.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley
